heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Ranking 6th, today's lightning strike count places it among the top days recorded since 11 April 2025.  The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 16 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (191°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.6°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 7%).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 355 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 612.4m higher than yesterday, 291.9m higher than the past week, 355.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 645m to a maximum of 1618m, averaging 1599.3m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1307.4m and 1954.7m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; heat will be very noticeable, though not extreme. Also, you’ll experience intense stickiness in the air and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and sunlight levels will peak at very high intensity. Similar weather conditions should remain.
